message.content:
1. The cardiac index improved in inoperable patients.
2. The least-squares mean difference of the cardiac index improvement in inoperable patients was +0.6 L/min/m2.
3. The 95% confidence interval for the cardiac index improvement in inoperable patients was 0.4 to 0.7.
4. The p-value for the cardiac index improvement in inoperable patients was less than 0.0001.
5. The cardiac index also changed in persistent/recurrent patients.
6. The change in the cardiac index for persistent/recurrent patients was +0.2 L/min/m2.
7. The 95% confidence interval for the cardiac index change in persistent/recurrent patients was -0.1 to 0.5.
8. The p-value for the cardiac index change in persistent/recurrent patients was 0.17.

messages.content:
Statement: Cardiac index improved in inoperable patients by a least-squares mean difference of +0.6 L/min/m2 (95% CI 0.4 to 0.7; p<0.0001), while in persistent/recurrent patients the change was +0.2 L/min/m2 (95% CI −0.1 to 0.5; p=0.17).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
